editionStmt.p: The initial version of this file was created from data kindly provided by the Ethiopic Manuscript Imaging Project directed by Steve Delamarter.

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

licence.p: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msContents.summary: Ff. i r(ecto): Asmat Prayer for protection from poisonous food. Ff. i v(erso)-ii r(ecto): Table blessing. F. ii r(ecto): Asmat prayer for use after cutting down a tree for medicine, mentioning Metropolitan Matewos and Our King Menilek. F-29r: Sword of Divinity, arranged for the days of the week: Monday (1r), Tuesday (5r), Wednedsday (9r), Thursday (12v), Friday (17r), Saturday (21v), Sunday (24r). F-35r: Image of the Trinity. F-42r: Image of Saint Giyorgis. : bottom, in red ink: Days of the year when the heavens are open to receive prayer. F-63r: Praises of Mary. F-64v: Praise of the Beloved, in honor of Saitn Mika'el. mentions owner, whose name has been erased and overwitten in blue ink with Gabra Takla Haymanot, the original owner's wife, Adsada Maryamand scribe, Nway Maryam.

origin.origDate: 1889-1913 (F. ii r mentions our Father Matewos and our Emperor Menilek)

revisionDesc.change: Created XML record from EMIP Collection Metadata.xsls
